docs.lead_paragraph: Megan Huntsman was clear about what she did with six of her newborn babies.

headline.main: Police: Utah Mom Admitted to Killing Her 6 Babies
headline.print_headline: Police: Utah Mom Admitted to Killing Her 6 Babies

docs.lead_paragraph: The ink on my arm says more complicated things about me than I meant it to.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Leslie Jamison describes her experience getting a tattoo, only to find out that it said more complicated things about herself than she had meant it to.
docs.snippet: The ink on my arm says more complicated things about me than I meant it to.

docs.lead_paragraph: Poll after poll over many years has shown that Americans overwhelmingly support legal access to abortion for women impregnated by rape. Yet the issue remains divisive, as demonstrated by two current rifts — one involving U.S. aid policy overseas, the other highlighting strategy differences within the U.S. anti-abortion movement.

headline.main: Abortion in Cases of Rape: New Rifts in Old Debate
headline.print_headline: Abortion in Cases of Rape: New Rifts in Old Debate

docs.snippet: Poll after poll over many years has shown that Americans overwhelmingly support legal access to abortion for women impregnated by rape. Yet the issue remains divisive, as demonstrated by two current rifts — one involving U.S. aid policy...

docs.lead_paragraph: A pregnant teenager, the daughter of an unmarried mother and granddaughter of another, is repeating family history. Does she decide to keep her baby and do her immature best to raise it, or choose adoption for her offspring?

headline.main: Chuck Lorre's Sitcom 'Mom' Adopts Serious Tone
headline.print_headline: Chuck Lorre's Sitcom 'Mom' Adopts Serious Tone

docs.snippet: A pregnant teenager, the daughter of an unmarried mother and granddaughter of another, is repeating family history. Does she decide to keep her baby and do her immature best to raise it, or choose adoption for her offspring?

docs.lead_paragraph: A female athlete with naturally high testosterone faces humiliating sex testing and worse.

headline.main: The Trouble With Too Much T
headline.print_headline: The Trouble With Too Much T

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by bioethicist Katrina Karkazis and Prof Rebecca Jordan-Young opposes testosterone level testing in determining whether female athletes are eligible to compete as women; holds tests and procedures to lower abnormally high testosterone are both humiliating and invasive; says these procedures and tests focus on nonexistent problem, as research shows that high testosterone does not guarantee superior athletic performance.
docs.snippet: A female athlete with naturally high testosterone faces humiliating sex testing and worse.

byline.original: By KATRINA KARKAZIS and REBECCA JORDAN-YOUNG

docs.lead_paragraph: Arizona lawmakers gave final passage on Wednesday to a bill that would allow state health authorities to conduct surprise inspections of abortion clinics without first obtaining a warrant, handing another legislative victory to abortion foes.

headline.main: Arizona Bill Passes Allowing Abortion Clinic Snap Inspections
headline.print_headline: Arizona Bill Passes Allowing Abortion Clinic Snap Inspections

docs.snippet: Arizona lawmakers gave final passage on Wednesday to a bill that would allow state health authorities to conduct surprise inspections of abortion clinics without first obtaining a warrant, handing another legislative victory to abortion foes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last month a baby in Tennessee made history: Emilia Maria Jesty was the first child born in the state to have a woman listed on the birth certificate as her "father."

headline.main: Two Moms, a Baby and a Legal First for U.S. Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Two Moms, a Baby and a Legal First for U.S. Gay Marriage

docs.snippet: Last month a baby in Tennessee made history: Emilia Maria Jesty was the first child born in the state to have a woman listed on the birth certificate as her "father."

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court panel on Tuesday issued an injunction blocking new Arizona abortion restrictions that are considered the most stringent in the nation, saying women likely would suffer irreparable harm if the rules are allowed to take effect.

headline.main: Court Extends Stay on New Arizona Abortion Rules
headline.print_headline: Court Extends Stay on New Arizona Abortion Rules

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court panel on Tuesday issued an injunction blocking new Arizona abortion restrictions that are considered the most stringent in the nation, saying women likely would suffer irreparable harm if the rules are allowed to take effect.

headline.main: Hospitals Safer Than Homes for Births

docs.abstract: A new analysis suggests that giving birth in a hospital is considerably safer than having a baby at home or in a birth center.
docs.snippet: A new analysis suggests that giving birth in a hospital is considerably safer than having a baby at home or in a birth center.
